main event: An unidentified aerial object described as balloon-shaped and silver in color was observed in Manitou Springs, Colorado on August 8, 1949.
interesting points: The object was observed for approximately three minutes by an eyewitness who believed it was a balloon., The eyewitness estimated the size of the object to be about one and a half feet in diameter., The sighting occurred during a time with good visibility and no other balloons were reported in the area., Extensive investigation failed to locate the object or other witnesses., The report concluded that the observed object was likely a balloon from the US Weather Bureau.
witness description: The observer is a 57-year-old male who previously worked as a pipe fitter and is considered reliable despite being somewhat talkative.
